post.body: Morning, man. CCS is kicking in already?
Oops! Missed the reply. Sorry, man. Morning to you, too. Doing well, I hope?
Yep. And @brokersaunders told her that was fine, and she wouldn't be back. A woman of her word. :-)
LMAO! Can I hatch a conspiracy or what? ;-)
LOL! You think maybe they're trying to poison us? Chance employee deaths are much better for company PR than layoffs... ;-)
Oh! Didn't know it was your birthday. Well, happy happy to ya, then!
Morning, SMM! Any chance of a 2 o'clock or 2:15 coffee tomorrow?
Good morning, my friend. Free lunch at work yesterday messed my stomach up something fierce. At least it was free. :-)
Morning, my friend. Sorry to hear that. Maybe you should get a Snuggi? ;-)
Indeed! I have all 5 books of the trilogy in one volume! ;-)
No worries! Thank you for the kind words. Hope people in this district feel the same in Nov. 2010!
Ah! No worries. Thanks for the correction. Much preesh!
I KNOW! We love Food Network, but those kitchens make me soooo jealous!
Good luck, lady! Not that you need it. You'll rock it.
A Face Off? Never took you for a hockey fan. :p
I COULD answer that, but I don't think you WANT me to. :-)
And if you'd actually READ & comprehend my points, rather than just waiting to give a response, we might get somewhere.
I was talking about intro(May) through passage(Jan) in House subcommittee. Think I made that clear. It IS in your reference.
Don't now why I bother sometimes. Pointless, but helps hone debate skills? Guess that's good reason. ;-)
Told you the intent 3 times. Believe it, don't, it's a fact. End discrimination by institutionalizing discrimination. Asinine.
The 8 months I referenced was from may of 63 to jan. 64 before it cleared House subcommittee. Have to count that.
Man, I'm working on a slow connection from a mobile phone. Your attitude is not warranted.
8 months.
I did read it. I've studied this. That's why I respect MLK,Jr. & despise Jackson & Sharpton. They've pimped out King's dream for $
Maybe logic DOESN'T beat feelings in this case. I'm tired of discussing this. Your bias & experience leaves no room for logic.
And what's the % on those numbers? Lot higher for Reps. That tell you anything? Dems FILIBUSTERED it in the Senate! Damn, man!
I know you have strong feeling about this, as you should. But logic & facts beat feelings every time.
I already told you! Civil Rights Act of 1964 on Wikipedia. Section 2.5.1- votes by party. It's all there.
Unless you were in Congress, the vote tally was not YOUR personal experience, marching was. Most Dems weren't marching with you.
WHAT!!?? If the bill had 49% support from Dems and over 80% from Reps, how did DEMS pass it? You're nuts!
All the marching & personal friendships in the world won't change it. Bless you for marching, but your party wasn't on your side.
I DID prove my point. Look at the numbers of votes, by party. Historical fact: Dems fought HARD against Civil Rights.
And, BTW, my point was that neither would have been passed without Republicans. Dems filibustered it, for God's sake.
Thanks Santa! http://sonsofliberty2K10.wordpress.com.
Wasn't sidestepping at all. Think I summed it up perfectly. Trying to end something by perpetuating it. Brilliant move.
Sure, combat discrimination by institutionalizing discrimination. Gov't creates problem & makes laws to fix 'em which create more.
Ah! No problem, my friend. Connecticut native, are you? Lovely country up that way.
Yup. Scary stuff. Be the same in the morning. Leave early for work. Them deers is cwazy!
Are we talking about the same place? I'm in New London, Virginia. ??
54? That's ALL?! Oh, well. Nobody's perfect, soldier! LOL! ;-)
Recount is over. I'm officially running. Send email to @lamontef again, hoping for maybe some response from either of you.
Ah! S'posed to meet @elliottjlb @ 3 tomorrow to get some decent pics taken. Will have Aidan w/me. You still there @ 4 or so?
My bad. It's #opfs now. Good debate, open to all political parties.
No idea. Don't follow as close as I used to. Know they need to win out and get help from Dallas or Bucs for Wild Card. Longshot :(
Morning, my friend! When you have some extra Tweet time and want good intelligent debate, follow the #fs. FreeSwim. Good stuff.
Thus, I must support others who oppose it. Especially McD, who's being railroaded by AFL-CIO thugs.
??? Both are against this ridiculous EFCA. As a worker in a union shop (not a member), I oppose #EFCAfail.
Congrats! Raise her right!
LMAO! Good one!
Well, I DID like the Dodge station wagon with the Hemi. What was that thing called? Won't buy GM or Chrysler anymore, tho. Leeches
Yep, not a bad vehicle. Stow&Go seats? Those are kewl.
Expecting much smaller turnout in 2010, though. Think we span about 10 counties, with large colleges in 7 of them.
Glad to hear it. Yes, keep that creativity going and it'll do the same for you! 5th District had over 300,000 voters in '08
@Lagwolf 2 kids here, so a sedan is still feasible. Hate driving a van. Reminds me of when I had learner's permit in Mom's van. :p
Very good here. Starting a couple more days off. Good Christmas, I hope?
Alrighty, then. I'll never wish you good luck on air again. Didn't seem to work out so well. I feel responsible somehow ;-)
Afternoon here, but I'll return your "Good morning" anyway. ;-) How's things?
That's good, at least. Been in home w/basement a little over 1yr now. No flooding yet, knock wood, but not much snow in VA, either.
LMAO! Not sure if that was meant to be a DM or not, but I enjoyed the Al Gore comment. Sorry about your basement, though. Not good.
@brokersaunders Yes, I blogged about all that months ago. Mark-to-market is EVIL! Stupid Sarbanes-Oxley. Need rolling avg.
Waiting on a call back & (hopefully) a pretty big campaign endorsement. Good luck on the air!
Good morning, smarty-britches! Doing well, I hope?
3,200 tweets! That calls for a W00t! Night, all. Early to bed and whatnot...
RT @lesliecarbone: My fellow Americans: Pls call your Repres. and urge him/her to vote against the Big-3 bail-out! http://www.house.gov/
RT @JonHenke: A very good sign from John Boehner and House Republicans. http://twurl.nl/2ju5h2
RT @KatonDawson: RT @goptom: RT @NYP ABC: U.S. Rep. Jesse Jackson Jr., D-Ill., Is 'Senate Candidate No. 5,' #tcot
Foggy as all hell in New London. Visibility next to nil. Perfect cover to dump a body. Just an observation, NOT advocating!
RT @spcghst440: #tcot http://bit.ly/c0hL Libertarian Purity Test - I got a 75 **Me, too!**
RT @Sweetnote @ScottHepburn @MyCreativeTeam A father is someone who carries pictures where his money used to be. *TRUE!*
RT @sanuzis: My response to RedState's questionaire...http://bit.ly/UInK #tcot #rncchair *1st RNC chair candidate to answer! Go Saul!*
Which brings up an interesting question: how many Governors have been impeached? Is "Pay-Rod" next? #demcorruption
RT @Appomattox_News: William Jefferson Clinton became 2nd president in the history of the United States to be impeached 10 yrs ago today.
#otlp I don't know if two of the Three Little Pigs getting married is a good idea. Seems rather incestuous to me. Just sayin' #otlp
#opfs Attention #tcot #hhrs #otlp Tweeps! FreeSwim (formerly #fs) is now #opfs. Good debate on all sides of political thought. Check it out!
#fs Anyone in FreeSwim looking for debate with libs? DO NOT invite @PeterSantilli! COMPLETELY incapable of reasoning!
Night all (will help you get your z's). Day one of two-day vacation tomorrow. Yippee-skippy and whatnot. 2009 already? *groan*
My 12/30/08 http://twinfluence.com score: Reach=573,339, Rank=#5,443
Wow! Twitter catharsis! @IsraelConsulate live-tweeting answers to Tweeters' questions. #askisrael #gaza (Check it #tcot 'ers!)
RT @vannschaffner: Possilbe headline for Onion: "Blago names Blago! For Senate!" #tcot *If Birth Cert. nuts are right, he can name Obama!*
RT @vannschaffner: RT @johnnyA: #tcot why aren't more of you following @newsbusters ? #srg *good question*
